text: Calhoun Hall (abbreviated CAL) is a building located on the University of Texas at Austin campus, built in 1968. The building is named after John William Calhoun, a mathematics professor, university comptroller from 1925 to 1937, and university president from 1937 to 1939. ==References== Category:1968 establishments in Texas Category:University and college buildings completed in 1968 Category:University of Texas at Austin campus
title: Calhoun Hall
